Topic.Title: Is Marissa here to pave YHOO for acquisition BY Facebook?

Message.Msg: I don;t know if you realize but when one signs up on FB and uses a secondary id during signup, say from Yahoo, FB stealthily (without permission) grabs all of your yahoo contacts and start introducing FB contacts to you that matches your yahoo contacts. How FB grab yahoo address book without yahoo password is troublesome - tells me either yahoo is complicit or yahoo security is lax and FB has it codes. Point is, FB already steals or gets data from Yahoo registered users who also uses FB account. FB is brazen, crooked and that is why they have to settle with FTC or is it FCC, over the issue of illegally tampering with user accounts. FB won't pay for yahoo if they can just steal their information. Yahoo search is worthless so there is no asset in FB that is worth legally absorbing in its fold.

Message.Title: YHOO, Cash, and Nov 2012
Message.Msg: Painting w/a broad brush, if by Nov 2012, and shd the stock price be ~$15/shr, YHOO will have a mkt cap of ~ $17 bln or so and ~ $10 bln in cash, with hardly any debt! (This assumes they don't acquire something which reduces the cash.) So; someone could 'pay-up' a buy for YHOO and essentially purchase 100% of YHOO (the whole ball of wax) for just $10 bln (ie., total price of $20 bln less the $10 bln cash YHOO will fork over to the new owner.) All these knuckleheads on blog-sites saying YHOO is going to $8/shr never did very well in their grammar school math classes I guess. What could 'kill' this scenario? YHOO BOD/CEO paying up to buy useless corps w/the cash (which I suppose is always possible giving the history of stupidity among YHOO execs.) Imo; all they have to do is do nothing....

Topic.Title: Read between lines - Yahoo to be acquired

Message.Msg: If the 'plan' of the BODs was to put YHOO up for sale she wouldn't have been made CEO, imo. Saying that, if they do nothing w/the cash they'll get (which will be difficult because this YHOO board will be prone to do something really, really stupid), there'll be an offer from someone in 60 days.....probably $18/shr which most will think is too low...but is there another bidder? Look at how much cash this comp will have (if they don't spend it) by Nov! Throwing in the cash, someone (MSFT?) can actually 'buy' YHOO in Nov for ~ 60% of $18/shr! That's assuming they don't spend it. Imo, the 'mkt' is betting the YHOO BODs and CEO WILL do something really really stupid w/the cash...otherwise the stock, right now, would be ~$17/shr and not under $15/shr. What a vote of confidence for YHOOs BOD and CEO!!!!!!!!!

Topic.Title: Dan Lobe buys Yahoo, break it apart, sold everything, and doubles his money.

Message.Msg: Yeah, everyone thinks MSFT, why not just taking Yahoo out right now. The key is that MSFT doesn't want to deal with Alibaba and Yahoo Japan. Even if there is money to be made, that distracts their business focus. They want Yahoo core, and that is it! They want the search, they want the media, they want the database, they want the user base and that is all they want. They will pay a premium for Yahoo as they paid for Skype, if someone like Dan Loeb would come in and break Yahoo up cleanly. Keep in mind, Even if we value core at 15 billion, it is still much better deal then what MSFT paid for Skype. Yahoo core is a loaded gun for profit. It has so much user base and it has the best social media potential. It connects TV entertainment, Movie entertainment and spawn it across 700 million users via email logins. My nephew and nieces used to use Facebook, then earlier this year, they dropped out and started to use Twitter, and just last month, they discovered Yahoo and started to experiment with Yahoo Bar. I am telling you, Yahoo is a giant waiting to be awaken. Any company, such as MSFT, Apple, FACebook ... if one of them get a hold of Yahoo Core, it is a check mate for the rest. In the mean time, MSFT will pay millions to ask Goldman or Mckinsey to tell them the same thing.... lol... oh, well, that is the way earth spins.

Message.Title: Reg FD and Yahoo value
Message.Msg: If Yahoo mgt is discussing other strategic alternatives for Yahoo with its BOD including representatives of major investors, it better be darn sure that it discloses those to retail investors in a timely and comprehensive manner or it may run afoul of Reg FD and fall into the same jeopardy as the FB underwriters and mgt.

Message.Title: MSFT offered $33 in 2008 when YHOO had far more shares out and AG was worth only a fraction of what it is.....
Message.Msg: ...now worth. $33 in 2008 is now (with less shares, much increased AG value, etc.) the equivilent of over $40 and perhaps as much as $50. MSFT could offer $25 now, sell Y-Jap (or perhaps it's already sold) take that and the the AG money (and clean up on other AG 20% in IPO) and YHOO cash, etc. and merge YHOO with Bing/MSnetwork (synergies and layoffs) and esentially pay half of what they offered four years ago and get YHOO core for virtually free. And $25 would have to be taken by YHOO BOD unless there is a bigger bid. Why would they not do this? And to boot MSFT shares (which they would use in takeover) are worth much more now so they would be getting YHOO for far less than half of what they offered in 2008..

Message.Title: PUT YOUR WORST FOOT FORWARD - A COMPANY POLICY
Message.Msg: Some companies know that you put your best people at the interface with your customers. If you have ever worked with Amazon customer service, you know what I mean. These message boards are the point of contact between many users and Yahoo. Yet, Yahoo, has assigned its least competent, least creative, least innovative least functional employees and managers to these boards. Unrealistic TOS that aren't enforced; automatic answers from customer care with no follow up; serial spammers running a major business stealing from users; thousands of political posts that have nothing to do with the companies in question; people answering and rating their own posts with alternate ID's; etc. If the Yahoo people are too lame to run a message board system, how do they ever expect to manage a major acquisiton? I expected better from the new Board of Directors. I

Topic.Title: Is Marissa here to pave YHOO for acquisition BY Facebook?

Message.Msg: i have no idea if FB and Yahoo has some sort of cross platform sharing already that is not announced in the public, all I do know is FB access Yahoo address book without permission if one uses FB and register a secondary ID using yahoo. It is suppose to be an ID that FB keeps on file in case one loses password, but FB is sneaky, they actually dig in to your yahoo email and takes the address book. How they do it without yahoo email password? who knows but I guess they have hacking power to do it. People have complained which is why there was a recent settlement between FB and FCC. FB would steal info rather than pay for it.

Topic.Title: Is Marissa here to pave YHOO for acquisition BY Facebook?

Message.Msg: 40% premium over closing price is the norm of a under valued company like Yahoo. If it is $25 Billion, acquirer can do half stock half cash and YHOO has the cash equivalent asset to pay for itself. GOOG submitted term sheet to buy YHOO ad tech division.... Marissa prob said to Serg and Larry why not buy the whole thing at $25 Bil and YHOO has at least $15 Bil cash and cash equivalent to cover the whole enchilada..... like paying for the whole MEDIA company (CNBC, NBC, etc alliance built in) at less than half the price. So you ask why Loeb "hired" MArissa shortly after GOOG submitte the term sheet to "buy ad tech division" ? The lady engineer is 6-month pregnant BUT all you need is 3 months or less to submit a term sheet to buy the whole YAHOO. So it is either GOOG or FB in serious tire kicking mode right before the water breaks.

Message.Title: Augme/Yahoo!
Message.Msg: Augme Technologies provides patent litigation update vs. Yahoo! Augme Technologies released the following update on the company's on-going patent enforcement activities, including its seven federal lawsuits involving four of the company's issued U.S. patents. Augme Technologies vs. Yahoo! (YHOO): On Aug. 9, the Court found, given the evidence presented, that the accused Yahoo! systems could not be found to infringe under the Court's interpretation of Augme's claims. The Court did not rule on invalidity issues raised by Yahoo!. Augme's CEO, Paul Arena said, "We continue to believe Yahoo!'s activities and products infringe the patents asserted against it as well as other patents in our portfolio not yet asserted against them. The final chapter on Augme's dispute with Yahoo! has yet to be written." Augme continues to maintain that Yahoo!'s targeted marketing systems use Augme's patented technology and constitutes an infringement of its patent portfolio that the company will ultimately resolve through licensing or litigation. The company is considering an appeal to the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington, DC, the highest patent court, of the summary judgment ruling by U.S. District Court. Augme also is exploring opportunities in conjunction with third party licensing partners to move its licensing program forward.
